title: How to roll for free on National Cheesesteak Day
text:
How to roll for free on National Cheesesteak Day Updated: March 23, 2017 — 8:27 AM EDT Share Michael Klein Staff Writer Michael Klein, editor/producer of Philly.com/food, has written about Philadelphia’s restaurant scene since 1993 in his Inquirer column, “Table Talk,” and on his Philly.com blog, “The Insider.” More by Michael Klein Arrow icon 
National Cheesesteak Day, which sounds like an oxymoron given the sandwich's Philadelphia roots, will be marked by giveaways and specials on Friday, March 24. 
Tony Luke Jr. will give away cheesesteaks from noon to 6 p.m. (or while supplies last) at his Tony Luke's shop in the Crossings at Twin Oaks in Sicklerville (663 Cross Keys Rd.) 
At Andalé Latino Grill (144 E. Street Rd. in Feasterville), Reza and Mirna Ghassemi have developed the chimichurri cheesesteak burrito, which contains grilled, sliced steak, chimichurri sauce, a blend of Monterey Jack and mild Cheddar cheeses, caramelized onions, pico de gallo, pickled cabbage and aji sauce. On March 24, everyone who dines in will receive one comp small burrito. Here's a backgrounder on Andalé 
Cousins Bill and Evelyn Balis of Adelphia Restaurant will roll back the price of their cheesesteaks to $4.95, which was the price on the menu when their fathers opened at 1750 Clements Bridge Road in Deptford in 1987. In addition to the cheesesteak rollback, they will offer comp mini-cheesesteaks at the bar during happy hour from 3 to 7 p.m. 
O'Donnell's Restaurant & Bar (401 N. Broadway, Gloucester City) will give out samples of its Heavyweight Fight "Belly Buster" cheesesteak from 3 to 7 p.m. with a purchase. Read more by
